reviews.text:
No lift at his station, for those with a push chair or wheelchair allow an extra 5-10 minutes to cross the line which you do by exiting the station, crossing the road bridge then re-enteting the station.
Toilets and cafe at station and self service ticket machine for when sales office is closed. Large car park.

It is OK but could do with a big overhaul. The key thing for me would be the Thameslink service to London Bridge (most of the trains are for London Victoria / Canterbury / Ashford etc) and hopefully we will have that for 2020. Staff are very good and it has the usual amenities such as paper shop and cafe. A little windswept on a cold and rainy and windy night though if you get off the train at the wrong end of the platform.
Good clean and safe. The staff here are quick, friendly and helpful. Well done!
Decent station opens out onto a nice park and pretty council building.
